vote.title: To authorize the Director of the Department of Development to modify and increase the contract with Aspyr for fiscal manager and other services as a partner in the City of Columbus CAREER 500 grant program; and to authorize an appropriation and expenditure within the Job Growth subfund. ($137,489.79)
vote.description:
Explanation
BACKGROUND: This ordinance authorizes the Director of the Department of Development to enter into a contract modification for fiscal manager and other services as a partner in the City of Columbus CAREER 500 grant program with Aspyr, in an amount of up to $137,489.79.
 
This contract was authorized by ordinance 2670-2024 in October of 2024. Aspyr is administering the Columbus CAREER 500 grant program, which aims to uplift 500 or more Columbus residents by supporting existing programs that provide training, wraparound support, and job placement services to underemployed individuals.
 
Seven organizations were selected to receive the initial grants. Based on performance, some organizations may be eligible for additional grants. These funds will support that additional funding towards the close of the program.
 
Amount of additional funds to be expended:  $137,489.79
Original Contract Amount:                                  $2,000,000.00 (ORD 2670-2024 | PO478211)
Modification #1 Amount:                                       $137,489.79
Total (Orig. + Modification):                              $2,137,489.79
 
Reason other procurement processes are not used:  
The contract with Aspyr represents a not-for-profit services contract, and their services on this project are ongoing. Aspyr holds and administers active subrecipient grants through the CAREER 500 program. It is not appropriate to disrupt their services and administration at this time.
 
How cost of modification was determined:
The cost of the modification was determined based on availability of funds within the City of Columbus to provide additional support for organizations who meet or exceed expectations within the CAREER 500 program, allowing these organizations to them to recruit, serve, and graduate even more clients.
 
Fiscal Impact: Funds are available within the Job Growth subfund (100015).
 
Title
To authorize the Director of the Department of Development to modify and increase the contract with Aspyr for fiscal manager and other services as a partner in the City of Columbus CAREER 500 grant program; and to authorize an appropriation and expenditure within the Job Growth subfund. ($137,489.79)
 
Body
WHEREAS, the Department of Development is engaged in a contract with Aspyr for fiscal manager and other services as a partner in the City of Columbus CAREER 500 grant program; and
 
WHEREAS, this contract was authorized by Ordinance No. 2670-2024 passed by City Council on October 7, 2024; and
 
WHEREAS, a contract modification is requested to provide additional support for organizations effectively serving clients through job training, placement, and retention services; and
 
WHEREAS, it has become necessary in the usual daily operation of the Director of the Department of Development to modify and increase the contract with Aspyr to continue services performed under the contract; NOW, THEREFORE,
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1.  That the Director of the Department of Development is hereby authorized to modify and increase the contract with Aspyr for fiscal manager and other services as a partner in the City of Columbus CAREER 500 grant program, in an amount up to $137,489.79.
 
SECTION 2.  That the Auditor is hereby authorized and directed to appropriate $137,489.79 within the general fund, fund 1000, subfund 100015, per the accounting codes in the attachment to this ordinance. 
 
SECTION 3.  That the expenditure of $137,489.79 or so much thereof as may be needed pursuant to the action authorized in SECTION 1 of this ordinance, is authorized in Fund 1000 (General Fund), in Object Class 03 (Services), per the accounting codes in the attachment to this ordinance.
 
SECTION 4. That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes to revise the funding source for all contracts or contract modifications associated with this ordinance. 
 
SECTION 5.  That this Ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
